climbs.name: Sunshine Surprise
climbs.fa: Euan Cameron and Julie Wright, 27th July 2014

content.description:
Start below the black streak on the right side of the wall.

Climb up onto the ramp and continue directly up to the shallow green groove.

Continue directly up the groove with fine engaging moves to reach easier climbing up to the large ledge.

Belay is located back and to the climbers left.

Scramble up either the dirty slope form the right or direct below on cleaner rock, but arrive at the base of the short vertical face.

Clip the first bolt and make a good sequence of move directly up the face to clip the next couple of bolts.

Continue up the slab with interest until possible to trend leftwards near the top to reach the anchors.
content.protection: 6 bolts, double ring anchors (equipped with Mussy Hooks).

content.description:
Start a few feet right of the toe of the buttress.   Climb up rightwards following the groove until possible to move directly up the steepening slab.

Climb directly up the wide shallow groove feature to gain quartz dike holds above.    Follows these holds up the wall to just below the top, then finish direct to the right of the pine tree.
content.protection: 8 bolts, double ring anchor  (equipped with Mussy Hooks).
content.location: Right side of the main face

content.description:
Climb the slab passing the first 3 bolts up to a mantle move onto a funky quartz dike.   From the dike move up the steepening face to reach a pocketed flake.

Follow the flake until possible to move right onto the face and continue directly up onto the easy angled slab to finish.
content.protection: 7 bolts, double ring anchors (equipped with Mussy Hooks).
content.location: Left side of the main face

content.description:
Start below to steep face on the right of the slab.

Climb up the face onto the easy angled slab via interesting moves on side-pulls and pinches.   Once on the slab follow it up and right before heading back left on the lip of the large niche.

Clip the last bolt then make a delicate rising rightwards traverse up to the anchors.
content.protection: 6 bolts, double ring anchors  (equipped with Mussy Hooks)

content.description:
Starting from the lowest point of the face climb directly up to a good stance at the 3rd bolt.   Now the fun begins.   Climb the slab above via some thin moves to gain the better holds on the quartz dike.

Continue directly above the dike to finish just left of the large pine tree.
content.protection: 7 bolts, double ring anchors  (equipped with Mussy Hooks).

climbs.name: Edgehog
climbs.fa: Euan Cameron, Justin Colville, Will Crick and Ryan DeBruyn, 24th Oct 2014

content.description:
Start on the far left side of the crag directly below the first bolt.

Make a thin tricky sequence up to the first bolt then continue via sloping rails and dikes to the large notch.  From the notch move up and right to the hanging slab.

Step up onto the hanging slab and follow its left edge all the way to the anchors with engaging moves and fine exposure.
content.protection: 9 bolts, double ring anchors (equipped with Mussy Hooks)
